alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 13 at 9:35PM EDT until July 14 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Franklin County in western Massachusetts... * Until 1245 AM EDT. * At 935 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Amherst, Greenfield, Orange, Deerfield, Montague, Hadley, Sunderland, Hatfield, Northfield, Bernardston, Conway, Shelburne, Leverett, Erving, Shutesbury, Colrain, Gill, Whately, Pelham and Royalston. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
